Article 2
The Italia Prize for Television shall be awarded to a work,
having the character of an artistic, cultural or scientific do¬
cumentary or a reportage, especially created for television.
Article 3
Every Organization Member of the Italia Prize is free to choose,
without any consideration of nationality, the Authors of the entries
to be submitted.
Should the entries submitted have already been telecast, they
must not have been put on the air more than one year before the
awarding of the Prize.
Article 4
The Italia Prize for Television may not be devided.
Article 5
The Jury of the Italia Prize for Television shall not examine
any entries other than those submitted by the Organizations parti¬
cipating in the International Competition of the Italia Prize,
which have accepted the Statute of the Prize and have fulfilled
all the conditions laid down by the said Statute.
Publicity entries will be rejected.
Article 6
The Jury shall examine only entries accompanied by a statement
by the Organization submitting them declaring that should the entry
be awarded a prize no right shall in anyway hinder s
a) the translations and indispensable adaptations of the entry;
b) the recording of the work by means of instruments suitable for
the reproduction of pictures and sounds, with a view to the
telecasts provided for under c) hereunder;
c) the two broadcasts of the entry, by each Organization taking
part in the Italia Prize for Television. For such broadcasts
the Authors shall be credited, at the very outside, with the
usual remuneration. No supplementary remuneration may be claimed
on account of the fact that work has been awarded a prize.
